sourcing.instructions: Al: Chemical supply store, Ba: Specialty metal supplier, P: Chemical supply store, Rb: Specialty chemical distributor
steps: Al: Chemical supply store, Ba: Specialty metal supplier, P: Chemical supply store, Rb: Specialty chemical distributor

1. Measure 4.5 g of aluminum powder (Al). 2. Measure 54.0 g of barium powder (Ba). 3. Measure 8.0 g of phosphorus (P). 4. Measure 6.0 g of rubidium (Rb). 5. In a clean, dry glass container, combine all measured ingredients thoroughly using a spatula to ensure an even mixture.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 4.5 g of aluminum powder (Al). 2. Measure 54.0 g of barium powder (Ba). 3. Measure 8.0 g of phosphorus (P). 4. Measure 6.0 g of rubidium (Rb). 5. In a clean, dry glass container, combine all measured ingredients thoroughly using a spatula to ensure an even mixture.

steps: 1. Transfer the blended material into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace at 800°C for 2 hours to facilitate reaction and fusion of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the blended material into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace at 800°C for 2 hours to facilitate reaction and fusion of the components.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature over a period of 4 hours to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature over a period of 4 hours to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Sand the surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 3. If desired, apply a sealant to enhance durability and surface protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Sand the surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 3. If desired, apply a sealant to enhance durability and surface protection.
